lines.text: You have a complete amnesia?
Complete... those six weeks are a total blank... Bob, is it possible that I was out of my mind when I got married?
That's the time most people do it.
You don't even remember your honeymoon?
Honeymoon? I don't even remember saying, "I do!"
You don't?
No, I don't. And what's more I don't even know if I did!
Is Rochester very far from here?
Rochester, New York?
Well, is there another one?
There's Rochester, Minnesota.
Two cities with the same name? I suppose this country's so big they ran out of names.
See you at dinner.
But, darling, I told you the boys are giving me a bachelor dinner tonight.
Oh, darn it. Can't I go?
No, it's a hundred percent stag. They'll just kid the pants off me and pull a lot of practical jokes.
Ooh... sounds ghastly.
Well, let them have their fun. They were single once.
Well, the kids aren't mine. I'm positive.
Oh, come on, Johnny. Only a fool says their positive.
Are you sure about that?
I'm positive.

[Tipsy]
You ever have amnesia?
I haven't had Magnesia since I was a kid.
Not Magnesia. Amnesia.
What's that? Natures spelled backwards?
Amnesia is the loss of memory. You don't know who you are or what you're doing.

[Points to the drink]
One more of those and you won't know who you are or what you're doing.
That's the end. He can't be out of his mind. He never had one.
John has a good mind.
Then why is he always going out of it?
